issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: The problem described is an issue which will never be fixed.
resolution.name: Won't Fix

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I think it might not relate to our sdk but want to keep this in database for future reference.

The simulators for Blackberry have no provision to change orientation to landscape or portrait & vice versa.
So,as of now we can't test orientation change issues on simulators.
fields.summary: BlackBerry : The BlackBerry simulators do not have any provision for screen orientation change
fields.environment:
Environment:
Ti Studio : 3.1.0.201302051415
Ti BB SDK : 3.1.0.v20130205151809
Mac OSX : 10.8.2
win 7 64 bit
Win 8 
BB simulator : 10.0.9.386
BB simulator : 10.1.0.338

comments.body:
There is an application to control the simulator (ex: change orientation).

https://developer.blackberry.com/devzone/develop/simulator/simulator_controller.html

Would this satisfy the needs for this ticket? If so please resolve, otherwise specify what is needed exactly.

Thanks for pointing out the controller,this is not user friendly as compared to our other platforms.Our customers or people normally won't go & fetch the controller or even if they knew it,its too cumbersome to keep cluster of things to running around just to change the orientation.

Also, for some of our tests in KS which tests orientation by changing itself (not manually through controller) how would that happen? 
If controller is the only way then we won't be able to test those orientation test cases in simulators ever.

There is nothing I can say 'I want', but I logged it so as in future ref or might be documentation thing.That's for to decide later.
Closing issue as we no longer offer support for BlackBerry.
